data.question: Could you provide me with practice problems on applications of the binomial theorem?

docs.title: 674dcd3ab00b977d048c92e0
docs.text: Using the substitution $z = \frac{1}{x+1}$, write down all the terms in the expansion of $6[1 + (1 + x)]$, leaving each term in the form $(1 + x)^p$ where $k$ and $p$ are integers.

docs.title: 674dcd15b00b977d048c92b7
docs.text: Write down the first four terms in the expansion of \( (1 - 4x)^6 \).

docs.title: 674dcd15b00b977d048c92b8
docs.text: Hence find the coefficient of \( x^3 \) in the expansion of \( (3x + 2)(1 - 4x)^6 \).

docs.title: 674dcd16b00b977d048c92b9
docs.text: Explain why there is no constant term in the expansion of \( \left( 12x + \frac{3}{x} \right)^{18} \).

docs.title: 674dcd3bb00b977d048c92e2
docs.text: Given that the coefficient of $x^2$ in the expansion of $(1 + 2x)^5(1 - px)$ is 20, find the two possible values of the constant $p$.

docs.title: 674dce8db00b977d048c93c6
docs.text: Given that \[ \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 0 \\ 3 & 0 & 3 \\ 2 & 2 & 1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ 13 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix} \], find the value of \( x \) and \( y \).

data.output:
(a) Using the substitution z = 2 - x, write down the terms in the expansion of [1 + (2 - x)]^5, leaving each term in the form k(2-x)^q where k and q are integers.

(ii) Hence show that the remainder when (3 - x)^5 is divided by 2 - x is 1.

(b) Given that the coefficient of x^3 in the expansion of (1 - x)(2 + qx)^4 is 35, find the possible values of the constant q.

The table below records the value of \( \theta \) for various values of \( t \). 

\[ \begin{array}{c|cccc} 
 t \text{ minutes} & 0 & 10 & 20 & 30 \\ 
 \hline 
 \theta^\circ C & 120.0 & 107.6 & 97.7 & 88.0 
\end{array} \] 

(i) On the grid given, plot \( \ln(\theta - 32) \) against \( t \) and draw a straight line graph.

The temperature, \( \theta^\circ C \), of a liquid placed in a container can be modelled by an equation of the form \( \theta = ae^{-bt} + 32 \), where \( a \) and \( b \) are constants and \( t \) is the time in minutes that the liquid has been left in the container. The table below records the value of \( \theta \) for various values of \( t \). 

\[ \begin{array}{c|cccc} 
 t \text{ minutes} & 0 & 10 & 20 & 30 \\ 
 \hline 
 \theta^\circ C & 120.0 & 107.6 & 97.7 & 88.0 
\end{array} \] 

(i) On the grid given, plot \( \ln(\theta - 32) \) against \( t \) and draw a straight line graph.

docs.title: 674dcd47b00b977d048c92fa
docs.text: Use the graph to estimate the value of each of the constants \( a \) and \( b \).

docs.title: 674dcd25b00b977d048c92c9
docs.text: (b) State the x-coordinate of the minimum point of \( y = f(x) \) and explain why it is the minimum point.

| t  |  10  |  20  |  30  |  40  |  50  |
|----|------|------|------|------|------|
| C  | 12.3 | 9.8  | 7.6  | 5.9  | 4.5  |

(a) On the grid given, plot ln C against t and draw a straight line graph.

(b) Use the graph to estimate the initial concentration of the chemical and the value of k.

(c) Assuming the model remains valid, after how many minutes would the concentration decrease to 2 mg/L?
